title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Boosting AI Performance: Networking for AI Inference

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Victor Moreno of Google Cloud outlines how networking must evolve to support AI inference by using AI-aware traffic routing, specialized load balancing, and service extensions to improve GPU utilization and lower latency. He highlights GKE Inference Gateway, inference-specific metrics (like KV cache utilization and queue depth), prefix caching, body-based routing, LoRA adapter awareness, and network-level guardrails that sanitize prompts before they consume GPU cycles.
bullets: Traditional networking and CPU-based metrics miss GPU saturation, causing blind load balancing and latency.
GKE Inference Gateway + AI-aware load balancing uses inference-specific metrics (KV cache use, queue depth) to pick least-loaded replicas.
Prefix caching and shadow cache copies let routers reuse prefill computations to reduce GPU work and cold starts.
Body-based routing and LoRA-awareness enable routing by model/context to appropriate replicas and APIs.
Service Extensions insert API management and AI guardrails at the network edge to sanitize requests, block invalid prompts, and save compute cost.
takeaways: Capacity planning must include GPU/accelerator telemetry (KV cache, queue depth) not just CPU, to avoid oversubscription and hidden congestion.
AI-aware routing and cache reuse can reduce peak GPU demand and cold-start spikes, lowering data center power and cooling peaks.
Network-level guardrails that block invalid requests before model execution cut unnecessary GPU cycles and energy use, reducing TCO.
Deploying these capabilities requires upgrades to load balancing, observability, and network service insertion—plan for network and orchestration investments accordingly.

items.title: Where Winds Meet is #RTXOn with DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this short video spotlights the open-world martial arts RPG Where Winds Meet running with NVIDIA DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation and with #RTXOn. The clip is credited to DigitalDreamsyt and promotes the game's visual/performance features enabled by NVIDIA technologies.
bullets: Showcases Where Winds Meet, an open-world martial arts RPG
Highlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation
Promotes running the game with #RTXOn (ray tracing)
Footage credited to DigitalDreamsyt
Published on NVIDIA GeForce channel (2026-01-14)
takeaways: DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation aims to improve frame efficiency — for cloud gaming and render farms this could lower energy per delivered frame while enabling higher throughput, affecting power provisioning and workload planning.
Enabling RTX (ray tracing) typically raises GPU compute and power draw versus non‑RT rendering, so data center/server capacity and cooling should be reviewed for ray‑traced workloads.

Wider adoption of advanced GPU features in gaming and cloud services can increase demand for high-end GPUs, with implications for supply chain, critical minerals sourcing, and lifecycle planning for hardware refreshes.
Higher-fidelity, ray-traced content may increase storage, networking, and IOPS demands for real-time streaming or build pipelines—plan for increased bandwidth and fast storage tiers.

items.title: The backbone of your steam plant’s reliability | GE Vernova

ai.summary: Based on the available description, GE Vernova emphasizes that anticipating an aging steam turbine rotor’s remaining life is critical to maintaining steam-plant reliability and outlines what to do next. The video points viewers to GE Vernova’s rotor end-of-life resources and presents the company as a leader in electrifying and decarbonizing energy.
bullets: Focus on assessing remaining life of steam turbine rotors to protect plant reliability.
Guidance on next steps for end-of-life (EOL) rotors is available via GE Vernova’s rotor-EOL resource.
Positions rotor lifecycle management as a core element of steam-plant uptime.
Produced by GE Vernova, with links to company channels and resources.
Encourages engagement with OEM expertise for rotor EOL decisions.
takeaways: Prioritize proactive rotor life assessments to reduce risk of unplanned outages and maintain capacity availability.
Incorporate rotor EOL timing into maintenance, outage scheduling, and capital planning for grid and data-center power assets.
Engage OEM resources early—use vendor EOL assessments to inform repair vs replacement decisions and lead-time planning.
Factor rotor lifecycle into broader reliability strategies when integrating renewables/storage or when planning flexible operation.

items.title: Rynek dóbr luksusowych w obliczu transformacji | Andrzej Marczak, Tomasz Wiśniewski

ai.summary: Based on the available description, KPMG's podcast discusses how the luxury goods market is shifting toward experiences, personalization and ESG commitments, with “affordable luxury” and Gen Z preferences reshaping demand. The episode highlights global trends (including a concentration of spending among the wealthiest), Poland’s growing but fragmented luxury market, the rise of luxury tourism and art, and future drivers such as AI and craftsmanship.
bullets: Global trends: “luxury fatigue” and concentration of spend — 2% of customers account for ~40% of the market.
Shift from ownership to experiences: personalization, exclusive experiences, and Gen Z preferring experiences over possessions.
ESG and responsible luxury: demand for eco-materials, certifications and transparent practices.
Poland: a growing but fragmented luxury market with rising participation from aspiring consumers and a developing luxury tourism/hospitality scene.
Future drivers include AI-enabled services, renewed emphasis on craftsmanship, and the expanding role of art and cultural offerings.
takeaways: Rising experiential luxury and premium hospitality in Poland can increase localized electricity demand and require reliable on-site power and backup for hotels, spas and venues.

Greater personalization and AI-driven services imply higher digital workload — plan for increased data-center capacity, edge computing and low-latency connectivity to support luxury retail and guest experiences.
ESG emphasis among luxury brands raises demand for renewable energy procurement, green certifications and energy-storage solutions to demonstrate sustainability credentials.
Operators should consider resilient microgrids, UPS and storage for premium sites to protect guest/customer experience and brand reputation during outages.
Supply-chain focus on high-end goods and electronics reinforces the need to track critical-minerals sourcing, recycling and secure procurement strategies relevant to manufacturers and tech suppliers.

items.title: PJM: Reliable Electricity is Our Priority

ai.summary: Based on the available description, since 1927 PJM Interconnection has made reliability its top priority. The video provides an overview of how PJM works to make sure electricity is available when you need it.
bullets: PJM has emphasized reliability as its core mission since 1927.
The video is an educational overview of how PJM works to ensure electricity availability.
Content focuses on operational roles and practices that keep power on.
Aimed at explaining PJM’s role in maintaining dependable electric service.
takeaways: For grid planners: PJM’s long-standing reliability focus signals continuity in regional operating practices to account for in planning decisions.
For data center operators: understanding PJM operations can inform backup, redundancy, and site selection strategies to ensure uptime.
For renewables and storage developers: insights into how PJM ensures supply can help with interconnection planning and integration strategies.
For facilities reliant on critical minerals or continuous processes: stable grid operations from PJM matter for operational resilience and supply-chain reliability.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video frames grid modernization as a need to balance reliability, flexibility, and efficiency while expanding capacity to support the energy transition. Hitachi Energy positions itself as delivering innovative power-grid technologies with digital solutions at the core to improve stability, reduce downtime, and optimize performance across system levels.
bullets: Grid modernization must balance reliability, flexibility, and efficiency while growing capacity for the energy transition.
Hitachi Energy emphasizes digital-first power-grid technologies.
Digital solutions are presented as a way to improve stability and reduce downtime.
Optimization is applied across substations, transmission and distribution levels.
takeaways: Prioritize digital grid technologies to boost stability and minimize outages—critical for data center uptime and other essential loads.
Plan capacity expansions that preserve reliability and flexibility to accommodate higher shares of renewables and storage.
Leverage digital analytics and control to optimize performance and lower operational costs across substations and networks.
Assess vendors offering integrated, digital-first solutions to future-proof grid and data center power infrastructure.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, resilient industries rely on energy efficiency, process optimization, and digital integration to stay productive and sustainable. Hitachi Energy says it partners with customers and other organizations to build smarter systems that improve productivity, reliability, and sustainability across operations.
bullets: Resilience depends on energy efficiency, optimized processes, and digital integration.
Hitachi Energy collaborates with customers and partners to deliver smarter systems.
Goals emphasized: improved productivity, greater reliability, and enhanced sustainability.
Focus is on system-level upgrades rather than single-point fixes.
Further information available via the provided link in the description.
takeaways: Assess energy-efficiency and process-optimization opportunities to boost resilience and lower operating costs.
Prioritize digital integration (monitoring, control, analytics) to improve reliability and enable predictive maintenance for grids and data centers.
Engage technology partners early to design system-level upgrades that align productivity, reliability, and sustainability goals.
When planning renewables, storage, or substation upgrades, consider holistic system design and digital tools to maximize performance and uptime.
